abstract: Egyptian prosecutors bring criminal charges of demonstrating without permit against 17 people who came forward as witnesses to police shooting of poet Shaimaa el-Sabbagh during march to Tahrir Square.
lead_paragraph: Egyptian prosecutors are bringing criminal charges against witnesses who said they saw the police kill an unarmed poet and activist during a demonstration, a lawyer who has seen the charges said on Monday.

headline.main: Witnesses, Who Say Police Killed Activist, Are to Be Charged in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Witnesses to Be Charged in Egypt, Lawyer Says

snippet: Egyptian prosecutors are bringing criminal charges against witnesses who said they saw the police kill an unarmed poet and activist during a demonstration, a lawyer who has seen the charges said on Monday.
